contentrichtext.text: {{unsourced|date=January 2009}} {{nihongo|''''Yasujiro Niwa'''|丹羽 保次郎|Niwa Yasujirō|extra=April 1, 1893 – February 28, 1975}} was a Japanese [[electrical engineer|electrical scientist]] from [[Matsusaka, Mie]]. In the 1920s, he invented a simple device for [[Mechanical television|phototelegraphic transmission]] through [[cable]] and later via [[radio]], a precursor to [[mechanical television]]. He later became the Director of the Department of Electronic Engineering of [[University of Tokyo]]. He was awarded the Order of Cultural Merits and the Order of Merit of the First Class. {{Authority control|VIAF=94312379}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Niwa, Yasujiro | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = April 1, 1893 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = February 28, 1975 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Niwa, Yasujiro}} [[Category:1893 births]] [[Category:1975 deaths]] [[Category:People from Mie Prefecture]] [[Category:Japanese engineers]] [[Category:Japanese inventors]] [[Category:Japanese scientists]] [[Category:Laureates of the Imperial Prize]] {{japan-scientist-stub}}
